page.title: 14Landscape,Coast,Scremerston.
page.content: Towards the coast the land is uncultivated with sand dunes and rocky cliffs.In some places the rocks stretch out to sea and at low tide many rock pools can be seen.Fossils and sea coal can be found in and near the rocky cliffs. There is the remains of an old{lime kiln }near the beach. The beach is sandy and the road to it crosses the main railway line near the old station which is now closed, although the old station house is occupied. In the rock pools many small fish, crabs and starfish can be seen and on the side of the rocks you can find {limpets,barnacles,whelks}and{winkles. Often after a very rough sea there is a lot of seaweed left on the beach and this is mainly bladderwrack.Just off the coast{seals}can be seen swimming in the sea.
